author: Michael M
title: Change of scenery
text:
After experiencing staying in Times Square for the first leg of our New York and beyond trip, we arranged to stay here for 3 nights prior to flying back to Australia. The location is great and is a welcome change from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Being located adjacent to Central Park and the Museum of Natural History you really couldn't ask for a better location. Our room, although a little on the small side, was very comfortable. Front desk staff were very polite and accommodating and were always happy to offer assistance. We did find the buffet breakfast a bit underwhelming with the hot food being lukewarm at best. Plenty of extremely satisfying dining options available around the Hotel. All in all a good stay for a couple of nights but probably wouldn't want to stay any longer than that.
